Description: Fragment of floor and foot of North Ionian Late Wild Goat Style pottery bowl; pale slip; interior: wide band in added red and three narrow dilute bands surround central lotus bud and petal cross; exterior: wide black band at junction of ring foot and wall; black band on underside.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 21, no. 33a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.178)
